Merge pull request #54 from gurjeet/link_fix

Update README.md to fix link to awsbok repo
Update README.md to fix link to awsbok repo
Adding special case for native-persona.org

Move the github ribbon down in the page

This button is the first thing that shows up in the list of
available links that screen readers produce. Moving it down the
page will allow users to find the login button more quickly.

Add alt text to the sign in button

Without this textual representation, the button is not really
visible to screen readers or to people who have images turned off.
Use loggedInUser instead of loggedInEmail (fixes #49)

Push scripts to the bottom and defer loading

To prevent a front-end single-point of failure and speed up
rendering of the page, I think that should be the recommended way
of setting up Persona.

Merge pull request #170 from mozilla/oauth-update-ansible-123done-poc

update ansible for 123done poc
fix(ansible): fix issuer_uri
fix(ansible): don't gen_keys anymore

fix(ansible): for 123done-poc
fix(ansible): s/sudo:/become:/g; s/sudo_user:/become_user:/g

Display a :lock: icon for users who signed in with 2FA (#165) r=@vladikoff

* fix(preverify): remove obsolete code that was for preVerifyToken support

The preVerifyToken functionality was removed in #158 so AFAICT
this code is no longer required.

* feat(oidc): Replace custom FxA flows with standard OpenID Connect.

This simplifies away a bunch of knowledge about the FxA server
ecosystem, replacing it with a lookup of the standard OpenID Connect
discovery document at /.well-known/openid-configuration.

It also probably breaks the "iframe" oauth flow, but I don't
think we're using that anywhere...?

* feat(amr): Reflect 2FA login status with a `lock` icon.

feat(email-first): Add support for the email-first flow. (#167) r=@vladikoff

Added a new button to handle email-first.

Because the FxaRelierClient has been deprecated and
I didn't want to update it to handle email-first, I removed
it from the dependency tree and built the query parameter
manually.

fix: Update fxa-relier-client to redirect off of the oauth server.

The relier client needs to know both the oauth and content server hosts.

The newest fxa-relier-client bounces off the oauth server instead of going directly to the content server. To handle this, we have to pass both the content server URI and oauth server URI to the relier-client on startup.
